reviews.text: we stayed here the summer of 2011 and had an awesome time! I have 2 young kids (11 & 9) and was very impressed with the family atmosphere. we were on the 15th floor, we had great views of the ocean and both pools. it was great having the tiki bar right on the beach, great drinks! the condo was very nice, comfortable, and spacious. we ate at pier park every night which was right across the road from the condo. we walked everywhere we went except for the water park. we will be staying here on future vacations.
reviews.title: Awesome condos

reviews.text: We stay here each year between Christmas and New Year's--great view of fireworks from the balcony. Our room is always clean. Great location--walking distance to Pier Park shopping and restaurants. We love this winter retreat.
reviews.title: Calypso Towers

reviews.text: Would highly recommend this condo and location. Large balcony off Living Room and Bedroom, clean and beautifully decorated; Large Master bath and walk in shower. Beach was beautiful. Weather was 70 and sunny! Excellent!!!!
reviews.title: Beautiful Condo stayed in 2-205

reviews.text: The location of the Calypso is perfect. It is not in the congested area, but there is still plenty to do around. Pier Park within walking distance with restaurants and other shops. There is a little sandwich/pizza shop directly across the Calypso that is convienent for lunch. There is also another beachside restaurant at the pier that we used for lunch. The Calypos has a beach bar that makes it handy to grab a cold drink while at the beach. Parking at the Calypso is across the street and there is a covered walkway that joins it. Beach chairs and an umbrella was included with our rental, and I would highly recommend for anyone to do the same. Our condo was on the 8th floor and it offered great views. We had a great time at the Calypso and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights recently at Calypso. We stayed in unit 1905 which was a beautiful unit in great condition. We had a large balcony with sliding doors going out from both the bedroom with king bed and from the living room. The unit has beautiful tile flooring, a nice updated kitchen, and a master bath with a walk-in shower, separate spa tub, two-sink vanity, and separate water closet. There's also a nice size walk-in closet in the back of the master bath. There was an additional half bath back by the entrance door. The unit also had a stack washer/dryer unit in a small separate room to the right of the entrance door. There was a big flat-screen television in the living room and comfortable seating.
reviews.title: Beautiful Condo and Nice Beach

reviews.text: This hotel has the best location on front beach road!!! I would not tell anyone to stay anywhere else!! Loved everything about it!!!
reviews.title: Don't stay anywhere else!!!

reviews.text: Calypso was wonderful! My husband and I were impressed the minute we walked in our unit! It was extremely clean and very spacious. The balcony was baby proof and that was very important because I've seen several hotels/condos that aren't. The pools were awesome, the staff as well as the guess were amazing, and the price was much cheaper than an oceanfront hotel. My family and I plan to return to Calypso every year!
reviews.title: Wonderful Springbreak! My family and I will be back!

reviews.text: We visited my parents who were renting here for 3 months this winter. What a wonderful spot. Big, well appointed rooms, 2 big pools, very clean, quiet facility. Walking distance to Pier Park and other amenities. The beach is lovely and there's chair service available (ours was included in our rental). Seadoo rentals were also available right in front of the bldg.
reviews.title: Super place to stay

reviews.text: We booked a condo (1005 E) through Paradise Beach Vacations. They gave us an expired door code, we called and they did not answer the phone, took over 1/2 hr to get the new code and be able to get in the condo just to find dirty sheets, molded shower, unfolded towels, fingernails on chairs and dried food on kitchen utensils....want more? we did not get the parking pass, so our car was almost towed away. Obviously, the cleaning service is not doing their job, but the rental company is not supervising either...Never again...
reviews.title: TERRIBLE...NEVER AGAIN!!

reviews.text: We rented a three bedroom condo on the 11th floor, it was unbelievable! The best view of the emerald coast. We found the condo to be very roomy and the large balcony was great. All I would add is a hot tub the resort and it would be even better. It came with our own personal beach chairs and umbrella which came in very useful in late August! Thanks Nick
reviews.title: Great place to enjoy the Gulf!

reviews.text: Before writing this review I reread the others. This is not five but it is a solid three. One if the previous reviews called it spot on. Condo are nice but hallway elevator problems and really poor beach service. Really bad beach service no hot tub. The beach at the time wad solid red flag. And a dirty beach. My dh spent the mornings cleaning it up.
reviews.title: Just average

reviews.text: This was a family trip and we have not never stayed at the Calypso Resort before i was very nerves about the hotel. But ever thing was very nice and the room was very clean. And we really enjoyed and we will be back.The Security was great.
reviews.title: VERY VERY NICE

reviews.text: My family Rented 2 condos at the Calypso for a week. One from a private owner and one from a property rental company. Both Condo's were ok, Nothing special but nice. I'd say average. Both the private owner and the rental company were nice. Both Condos had issues upon arrival but were handled properly and promptly.1st the good.The location is wonderful. The Calypso is within easy walking distance to pier park. This is really the only great thing about it. Now the bad. Poor design of the corridor where you have to go to get to the elevators. They are too narrow and 2 people with luggage carts can't pass. Not enough elevators. Only 3 per tower, they need at least 4. Who wants to spend their entire vacation waiting on elevators? NO HOT TUB. This was a biggie for my wife who enjoys the hot tub at night. Poor pool design. The pools are too narrow. I saved the worst for last. They have 2 rows of rental beach chairs and umbrellas at the beach. They stretch almost the entire length of the property. You can't set up you own umbrella or tent in front of them. This leaves you a long way back from the water with no view of the ocean and very little breeze. We set our tent one day on one end near the beach. The wave runner rental people told us we had to move because they rent 20 ft. We were clearly outside their 20ft cones, they were claiming more like 40 ft. We augured with them and they let us stay. We left the frame to our tent overnight. The next morning it was gone. We found it had been moved about 20 feet away. Obviously the wave runner people had moved it. Again our location was clearly not in their space. With the 2 rows of rental chairs stretching across almost the entire beachfront and the wave runner rental you can't set your own tent or umbrella near the water. It seems the Calypso cares more about the all mighty dollar than it does about it's guest. We stayed at the Emerald beach by Wyndam twice last year. It's 3/4 of a mile further from the pier park but a lot better and a little less expensive . We will be staying their next year instead of the Calypso
reviews.title: Good location but has a few issues

reviews.text: We rented a condo through a company called Oaseas. We found the condo on VRBO.com but, the owner used Oaseas. Anyway, they were great. they are located right across the street from the condo itself.
reviews.title: Very nice resort, great location. Rented through Oaseas.

reviews.text: The condo was built in 2006 I believe, still very new. Great shape. They have a Tiki bar that is right in front of the ocean. I hear the HOA doesn't like it so it may not stay open long, but we loved having a frozen drink & staring at the water!!
reviews.title: Excellent property

reviews.text: This was our first time staying in Panama City Beach after many visits to Destin. We loved the Calypso because it was so close to Pier Park and right on the beach! We had a 3 bedroom/2 bath condo on the 16th floor. The unit was extremely clean and well maintained. There were 3 elevators and they were pretty efficient. Security was present at the parking garage, entrances to the pools and in front of the building. We didn't use the tiki bar but it looked like a good time. There were 2 pools and they were well-maintained and clean. Everything we needed was within walking distance with the exception of the grocery store (Winn Dixie) which was about 3-4 minutes west of the complex. We will come back.
reviews.title: Loved this place!

reviews.text: 3BR/3BATH corner unit. May 2012. Customer service at the front desk and at the beach chairs was unsatisfactory. The showers were all moldy. Dirty, pet stained carpet to the point I was uncomfortable placing the baby on the carpet. The armoire in a child’s bedroom is not bolted together so there is a high possibility that if bumped or pulled on, it could fall on the child. TV in one bedroom was broken--no help to fix. Beach chairs have to be reserved each day even though after a big tip on the first day, the guy told us we could have the same chairs. The next day, our belongings, which were bagged up and placed in between the chairs, were out of the bags and thrown all over the beach (30 ft linear distance). The chair guy admitted doing it. The front desk said they had no oversight with the chair people since it was contracted out (easy way to fix that is to cancel the contract and get better people). The corridors to the rooms were so narrow that a cart or baby stroller took up the entire space and no one could pass in either direction. There is no wifi in the condos and only one short cord so multiple people cannot be online at one time. We requested a blanket for the fold out sofa-bed and it took three days of phone calls and visits to the front desk to receive it. There were not enough chairs at the pool. When the “courtesy patrol” was asked to clear chairs that had towels but no people, they would not. When I complained and said that the chair situation was enough to make us not return, his replay was “I don’t blame you.” The Calypso is not a “value” type condo. We paid top dollar and I feel like the Motel 6 type places may have been cleaner and had better service. I was hard not to let on to the kids how disappointed all the adults were in the Calypso.
reviews.title: Dangerous room conditions

reviews.text: We have been going to Panama City Beach for many years. This was our 4th stay at Calypso. We like it because it is upscale and right across the street from Pier Park, which is a shopping center with lots of great restaurants, shops, clubs, and activities for the kids. We rented our unit through VRBO.com for the first time and saved about $300.00! Our unit # was 109 E and was located on the 1st floor near the pool, beach access and tiki bar. We loved being right in the middle of all of the action, not having to wait for the elevators, and being able to just walk out our door and be on the street in minutes. This unit was 2 BR / 2 BA. It had granite countertops throughout, new furnishings throughout with pretty decor. The kitchen was large and well stocked. The MBR was large, with a king bed, large closet, large shower and a tub and a private entry to the balcony. The 2nd BR was ample with a pass-thru bathroom and queen bed. The living room also had balcony access and was spacious, comfortable and well appointed. We were really pleased and plan to rent this unit again! If you have never been to Panama City Beach, give it a try! We have been to many islands in the Caribbean, and PCB is just as beautiful!
reviews.title: Great location, Great Condo, Beautiful Beach!

reviews.text: We rented a 3 bedroom 2 bath from PCBLP.com the last week in April. We had such a great time. The condo was clean and on a great floor. We saw dolphins and rays almost everyday from the balcony. Two beach rental chairs came with the condo. They had it set up everyday ready to go. Short walk to Pier Park, the pier and the helicopter tour.
reviews.title: Excellent Vacation

reviews.text: Stayed in west wing, room 1605. Room had smell of pet urine when you opened door, bedding was dirty, and tub was full of mold. I complained of dirty bedding and was originally told that since "the hotel rep" did not see anything, the bedding was not changed. It took another call just to get someone to replace bedding. The shower was full of black mold around the base of shower. I complained and asked if bleach could be put added, nothing was done. Second bathroom had strong pet urine smell. Suffice to say I was highly disappointed. Friends of ours had rooms on other floors that were much better than ours.
reviews.title: Moldy Shower
